intro: Achyrophorus setosus, commonly known as the hairy achyrosperma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, ovate leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
